intro: Sorocephalus diversifolius, commonly known as the variable-leaf sorocephalus, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its diverse leaf shapes, which vary depending on environmental conditions. It produces small, white or pale pink flowers that are typically clustered in umbels. Sorocephalus diversifolius is often found in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid climates.
